title: The competent programmer is fully aware of the strictly limited size of his own skull; therefore, he approaches the programming task in full humility.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

title: The best is the enemy of the good. Working toward perfection might prevent completion. Complete it first, and then perfect it.
author: Code Complete

title: We should forget about small efficiencies, say about 97% of the time: premature optimization is the root of all evil.
author: Donald Knuth

title: Software's Primary Technical Imperative: Managing Complexity.
author: Code Complete

title: Don't change the code randomly. That's voodoo programming.
General Principle of Software Quality: Improving quality reduces development costs.
author: Code Complete

title: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler
